Articles.Content: True but 8 will be more than enough to take out even Tier 4 armor ships. I was considering going for some SRB's too but they tend to not be as effective for me. I like shooting off at ships from 20km away .

True but 8 will be more than enough to take out even Tier 4 armor ships. I was considering going for some SRB's too but they tend to not be as effective for me. I like shooting off at ships from 20km away .

Tier 4? lol What?

Tier 4? lol What?

Tier 4 armor is when you reinforce the armor against a central spine not directly linked to the command pod. So when a projectile strikes your ship the impact is taken by the armor and reinforcement rather than simply knocking your command pod off within the armor. Also if you double layer or triple layer this it can prove almost impervious to smaller caliber weapons.

I'll end up explaining this probably in KSP Naval Academy Ep 9 Armor and Turn Based Tactics.
Oh, that's what's on the Nautilus-class.

Yes if reinforced properly it takes several hits to kill it or you can be like me and figure out at witch speed your missile wigs out and ignore the armor . I tend not to do this to often because it make it harder to aim the missile and I consider it an exploit. So don't worry I'm not killing cans with tetryon trans phasic modulation weaponry.

Tier 4 armor is when you reinforce the armor against a central spine not directly linked to the command pod. So when a projectile strikes your ship the impact is taken by the armor and reinforcement rather than simply knocking your command pod off within the armor. Also if you double layer or triple layer this it can prove almost impervious to smaller caliber weapons.

I'll end up explaining this probably in KSP Naval Academy Ep 9 Armor and Turn Based Tactics.

That's tier 3. Tier 4 is where the fuel tanks are also separated from the spine on separate pieces to even further improve shock absorption.
